rComments: Professor Taylor teaches you how to fish instead of giving you a fish. Her lectures are engaing and her slides are thorough. Compared to other professors who are indifferent if you do well or not, she really cares about your performance as she mentions she understands the importance of your grades becasue she was a student once. Take her in stride.

Failed me on my final assignment and stopped responding to my emails when I asked to meet with her. Really interesting concept for a class (Immigration, Ethnicity & Crime) but as someone who is not an immigrant and forced to write on my "own immigration story", it almost felt like I was the one teaching her. Disappointing and would not recommend.

You literally wont learn anything about the content. She has a P.H.D in feelings and doesnt stop talking about her early childhood and how hard it was. I took the classes to become more familiar with the content yet nothing she does continue this knowledge. She would be a good therapist or elementary teacher, not a university professor.

One of the best courses I took at U of T. It really added perspective and made me think about issues in a different way. Her class, Prof. Grace Tran's class, and Prof Catherine Evan's class are all on par insofar as they make you question the legal system and work for your grade -but it's really worth it at the end. 10/10

She's very polite, but the class leaves a lot to be desired. "lectures" are just conversations, which is fine for some but is not fine when you consider the large amount of reading that is assigned. She lacks transparency on "quercus", meaning when she says "attendance is mandatory" she means it. definitely wont take her again, very odd class...
Nicest prof I've ever had. Also the only one that I think might actually like teaching, rather than doing so as an obligation.

Professor Taylor is a visionary. Taylor has the ability to make you think in ways that you did not even know you were capable of. She gives you confidence in yourself that you are smart, and you deserve to be at UofT, whereas other professors do not even care. If you can take her course, do it. It will change your life, for the better. I LOVE HER!!

Professor Taylor is truly special. She shows a sensitivity and openness that I haven't experienced at UofT before and wants you to actually learn, not just get a grade and go. If you care about the course content and put in the work, you will do great. She makes going to class enjoyable and she does not lecture, but she facilitates conversation.

The most inspiring professor at U of T. I have taken 4 of her courses and all of them were amazing. The reason I chose to write this review is because she actually cares for students. She is understanding and wants you to do well. Anytime you have any issues she is willing to talk and help you. Also, she doesn't ask you to buy textbooks.

Very lecture heavy and is almost always about the same thing. Material gets extremely repetitive without innovation. If one is not a liberal or has any conervative/non- left tendencies, the class will sound like extreme propaganda. If one agrees with Professor Taylor's ideals, it would suit them fine.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lecture heavy', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: great prof. so inspiring my best learning exp. at u of t. lots of readings tho but the content is great
TAKE TAYLOR, YOU WON'T REGRET IT!!! She's amazing, she makes her students weep and care about the material being taught. Truly an amazing prof

Lots of reading. She is an amazing prof and will have you thinking in ways about topics that you would never expect! Super personable and understanding of tough situations. Amazing for a recommendation if you're trying to go to law school you should definitely get to know her.

This professor is great, she is passionate about social justice and gender equality. However, most of her courses are kind of the same. Whether its Youth Justice, Punishment or Aboriginal Justice. it is always focused on the marginalized population. Which is great for me but I understand it is not everyones cup of tea. Extreme amount of readings.
What a passionate professor who clearly believes what she lectures about. She works hard to make sure everyone succeeds and understands the course material.

by far my favorite professor I have taken 2 classes with her and i will take another class with her if given a chance. she is so inspirational and sweet and made me think out side the box I encourage you to take her classes  and it'll help you understand that there are always different ways of seeing things. she will go out of her way to help.

Lectures are way too longg and she talks soo much. Personally she lost me after 2 hours of lecturing. Her readings are too much and too long. Her assignments are also not your typical research essay assignments which can be either good or bad depending on who you are. I love her personality just dont like her as a professor. High expectations.

You will either love or hate this professor. While she is very passionate about her subject, the material is EXTREMELY biased. I found the course material interesting, but at times I felt very frustrated sitting in her three hour class feeling like I was being forcefed the liberal agenda. Get ready to read 40-50 pages per week.

She is the best professor I have ever had. While I did not always do the all of the reading she required for class (she asked for a great deal of reading done before class), but I still managed to get an A at the end. She knows what she's doing and she knows that background reading helps consolidate information. She's very understanding and is huma
Pretty good teacher, was reading intensive but the readings themselves were pretty easy to understand.  Open-ended test questions.

Taylor was a really inspiring & engaging professor, with quirky jokes. We discussed really interesting topics in a well-thought out/new manner. I've been able to apply a ton of what I learned in her class to other classes. However, the class was very reading/media heavy, and the TAs were overly tough markers.
teacherRatingTags: ['Amazing lectures', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Her class is one of the most interesting and eye opening classes I have taken in all my four years, and I have been able to apply what I learnt in her class to many other courses and even wrote some essays in other courses based on the readings she has assigned. The course is reading intensive, but the readings are very interesting. Good job

Excessive readings on the same idea, week in, week out.  Hundreds of pages and hours of videos all say the same thing about the justice system  more of a "gender studies" type course than anything related to punishment, even though "Punishment" was the title of the course Lectures were long, boring and as someone accurately said, self indulgent
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Group projects', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Lectures are overwhelming, one-sided and self-indulgent. Uninspired metaphors used in place of real theories. Lecture topics and readings are disjointed. 200-250 pages and hour long videos a week. Grading criteria is vague and subjective. A course about crime and punishment delivered as a gender studies course. I advise you to avoid this professor.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework', 'Tough grader']

rComments: By far one of the best professors I've had. She genuinely cares about her students and goes the extra mile to give you the tools to help you succeed.

Hands down my least favourite professor I've had at UofT. Lectures are EXTREMELY dense and very in-cohesive. Readings are incredibly overwhelming. She expects far too much from her students from a 300-level course. Strongly recommend switching out of any course you have with this professor.

She sets the bar high for other profs in the department and her attitude and interaction through email or outside class makes room for comfortable discussion. Her class truly made me less afraid of thinking outside the box. Original thinking is encouraged and I love that about her. I think she cares. I hated the first class, but she DID know better
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Get ready to read', 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: Really hope the person below ended up dropping the course, because they really didn't grasp the key concepts behind the material and how it is supposed to be presented. Lectures and readings are extremely heavy, but she does a great job illustrating them. CRI340 is designed to illustrate the views we don't hear about - to critique the views we know

In a course that was supposed to be about punishment, she never strayed from the subject of racial injustice within the system and how the system is rigged against non-whites At no point did she assign or present any views that were divergent from her criticism, and the massive number of readings and video assigned always said the EXACT SAME Thing
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework']
